00036 // File local defines
00038 #define DEF_RAW_OUTPUT_FILENAME                         "raw_values.dat"                                        
00039 #define DEF_PARSED_OUTPUT_FILENAME                      "parsed_values.dat"                                     
00041 #define DEF_NUM_EVENTS                                          -1                                                                      
00042 #define DEF_BASE_ADDRESS                                        0x3210                                                          
00043 #define DEF_BOARD_TYPE_STR                                      "V792A"                                                         
00044 #define DEF_V792_TYPE                                           CVT_V792_TYPE_A                                         
00045 #define DEF_ZERO_SUPPRESSION_PARAMS                     "0"                                                                     
00046 #define DEF_CONFIG_FILENAME                                     "CAENqtpDemo.conf"                                      
00047 #define DEF_GNU_PLOT_PATH                                       ""                                                                      
00048 #define DEF_GNU_PLOT_REFRESH                            500

00067 /**************************************************
00068 **************************************************/
00069 BOOL user_settings_open( user_setting_data* p_data) {
00070     // module variable init
00071     p_data->m_raw_output_filename= (char*)malloc( MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT);
00072     p_data->m_parsed_output_filename= (char*)malloc( MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT);
00073 
00074     p_data->m_gnu_plot_path= (char*)malloc( MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT);
00075     p_data->m_config_filename= (char*)malloc( MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT);
00076 
00077     p_data->m_gnu_plot_refresh= DEF_GNU_PLOT_REFRESH;
00078     p_data->m_gnu_plot_x_scale= DEF_GNU_PLOT_X_SCALE;
00079 
00080     // setting default values ...
00081         if ( p_data->m_raw_output_filename== NULL) {
00082         TRACE("user setting module: insufficient memory !\n");
00083         } else {
00084         strcpy( p_data->m_raw_output_filename, DEF_RAW_OUTPUT_FILENAME);
00085         }
00086 
00087         if ( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename== NULL) {
00088         TRACE("user setting module: insufficient memory !\n");
00089         } else {
00090         strcpy( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename, DEF_PARSED_OUTPUT_FILENAME);
00091         }
00092 
00093         if ( p_data->m_gnu_plot_path== NULL) {
00094         TRACE("user setting module: insufficient memory !\n");
00095         } else {
00096         strcpy( p_data->m_gnu_plot_path, DEF_GNU_PLOT_PATH);
00097         }
00098 
00099         if ( p_data->m_config_filename== NULL) {
00100         TRACE("user setting module: insufficient memory !\n");
00101         } else {
00102         strcpy( p_data->m_config_filename, DEF_CONFIG_FILENAME);
00103         }
00104 
00105     p_data->m_num_events= DEF_NUM_EVENTS;
00106     p_data->m_base_address= DEF_BASE_ADDRESS;
00107     p_data->m_qtp_type= DEF_V792_TYPE;
00108 
00109         parse_zero_suppression_thresholds( DEF_ZERO_SUPPRESSION_PARAMS, p_data->m_zero_suppression_param.m_thresholds_buff);
00110         parse_zero_suppression_thresholds( DEF_ZERO_SUPPRESSION_PARAMS, p_data->m_zero_suppression_param.m_high_thresholds_buff);
00111 
00112     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_count_all_events= FALSE;
00113     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_empty_enable= FALSE;
00114     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_overflow_suppression_enable= FALSE;
00115     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_sliding_scale_enable= FALSE;
00116     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_zero_suppression_enable= FALSE;
00117     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_valid_suppression_enable= FALSE;
00118     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_common_stop_enable= FALSE;
00119 
00120     return TRUE;
00121 }
00122 /**************************************************
00123 **************************************************/
00124 BOOL user_settings_close( user_setting_data* p_data) {
00125     // module variable free
00126     if ( p_data->m_raw_output_filename)
00127         free( p_data->m_raw_output_filename);
00128     if ( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename)
00129         free( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename);
00130 
00131     // setting invalid values ...
00132     p_data->m_raw_output_filename= NULL;
00133     p_data->m_parsed_output_filename= NULL;
00134 
00135     return TRUE;
00136 }

00138 /**************************************************
00139 **************************************************/
00140 BOOL user_settings_parse_input_param( user_setting_data* p_data, int argc, char* argv[]) {
00141     BOOL help_to_show= FALSE;
00142     int i;
00143     for ( i= 1; i< argc; i++) {
00144         if ( !strcmp( argv[i], "-h")||
00145                 !strcmp( argv[i], "-H")) {
00146             help_to_show= TRUE;
00147         } else if ( !strncmp( argv[i], "-f", 2)||
00148                     !strncmp( argv[i], "-F", 2)) {
00149             // config filename
00150             strcpy( p_data->m_config_filename, argv[i]+ 2);
00151         } else {
00152             // Unknown parameter
00153             TRACE1("\nuser settings: ignored command line parameter '%s'", argv[i]);
00154             TRACE("\n  restart with -h flag for help on usage\n");
00155             help_to_show= TRUE;
00156 
00157         }
00158     }
00159     if ( help_to_show) {
00160         // show help screen
00161         TRACE ( "\n");
00162         TRACE ( "CAEN qtp Demo usage:    CAENqtpDemo {params_list}\n");
00163         TRACE ( "params_list:\n");
00164         TRACE ( "-ffilename | -Ffilename\n");
00165         TRACE1( "      filename= configuration filename. If not specified '%s' will be assumed.\n", DEF_CONFIG_FILENAME);
00166         TRACE ( "           example: CAENqtpDemo -f\"CAENqtpDemo.conf\"\n");
00167         TRACE ( "                    CAENqtpDemo -FCAENqtpDemo.conf\n");
00168         TRACE ( "-h | -H\n");
00169         TRACE ( "      Show this help screen\n");
00170         TRACE ( "           example: CAENqtpDemo -h\n");
00171         TRACE ( "\n");
00172         TRACE ( "Hit a key to continue ... \n");
00173         while ( !kbhit());
00174         return FALSE;
00175     }
00176     if ( !parse_config_file( p_data))
00177         return FALSE;
00178     return TRUE;
00179 }
00180 /**************************************************
00181 **************************************************/
00182 BOOL parse_config_file( user_setting_data* p_data) {
00183     // char line[ 200];
00184     char org_line[ 200];
00185     char *line;
00186     char org_str[200];
00187     char *str;
00188     FILE *p_conf_file= NULL;
00189     BOOL ret_val= TRUE;
00190     char trim_space_charset[]= {' ', '\t', '\n'};
00191     char trim_text_charset[]= {' ', '\t', '"', '\n'};
00192 
00193 
00194     if ( ( p_conf_file= fopen( p_data->m_config_filename, "r"))== NULL) {
00195         TRACE1(" Cannot open configuration file %s\n", p_data->m_config_filename);
00196         return FALSE;
00197     }
00198     TRACE1(" Reading configuration file '%s' ...", p_data->m_config_filename);
00199     while (!feof( p_conf_file)) {
00200         fgets( org_line, sizeof( org_line), p_conf_file);  // read the whole line
00201                 line= trim( trim_space_charset, sizeof( trim_space_charset), org_line);;
00202         if ( !strlen( line)) {
00203             continue;
00204         }
00205                 sscanf( line, "%s", org_str);  // read one string from the file
00206         str= trim( trim_space_charset, sizeof( trim_space_charset), org_str);
00207                 line+= strlen( str);
00208         if ( !strlen( str)) {
00209             continue;
00210         }
00211         if ( str[0] == '#') {
00212             continue;
00213         }
00214 
00215         // The board base address (16 bytes MSW hex format)
00216         if ( !stricmp(str, "BASE_ADDRESS")) {
00217             int value= 0;
00218             sscanf( line, "%x", &value);
00219             p_data->m_base_address= value;
00220             continue;
00221         }
00222 
00223         // The link number (dec format)
00224         if ( !stricmp(str, "LINK_NUMBER")) {
00225             int value= 0;
00226             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00227                         p_data->m_link_number= value;
00228             continue;
00229         }
00230 
00231         // The board number (dec format)
00232         if ( !stricmp(str, "BOARD_NUMBER")) {
00233             int value= 0;
00234             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00235                         p_data->m_board_number= value;
00236             continue;
00237         }
00238 
00239         // The QTP's type: Valid values are: V792A, V792N
00240         if ( !stricmp(str, "QTP_TYPE")) {
00241             char value[ 100];
00242             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00243             if ( !stricmp( value, "v792a")) {
00244                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V792_TYPE_A;
00245             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v792n")) {
00246                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V792_TYPE_N;
00247             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v862a")) {
00248                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V862_TYPE_A;
00249             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v965")) {
00250                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V965;
00251             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v965a")) {
00252                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V965_TYPE_A;
00253             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v785a")) {
00254                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V785_TYPE_A;
00255             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v785n")) {
00256                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V785_TYPE_N;
00257             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v1785")) {
00258                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V1785;
00259             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v775a")) {
00260                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V775_TYPE_A;
00261             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v775n")) {
00262                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V775_TYPE_N;
00263             } else {
00264                 // Bad parameter
00265                 TRACE1("\nuser settings: bad QTP type '%s'", value);
00266             }
00267             continue;
00268         }
00269         // The number of events to acquire:
00270         // A non positive number means don't care (i.e. acquire until key pressed)
00271         if ( !stricmp(str, "NUM_EVENTS")) {
00272             long value= 0;
00273             sscanf( line, "%ld", &value);
00274             p_data->m_num_events= value;
00275             continue;
00276         }
00277         // The zero suppression threshold resolution
00278         if ( !stricmp(str, "STEP_THRESHOLD")) {
00279             int value= 0;
00280             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00281             p_data->m_zero_suppression_param.m_step_threshold= value;
00282             continue;
00283         }
00284         // The thresholds buffer (value and kill bit) (comma separated values)
00285                 // for dual range boards (V965, V1785) these are the low range thresholds
00286         if ( !stricmp(str, "THRESHOLDS")) {
00287             char value[ 100];
00288             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00289                         parse_zero_suppression_thresholds( value, p_data->m_zero_suppression_param.m_thresholds_buff);
00290             continue;
00291         }
00292         // The high range thresholds buffer (value and kill bit) (comma separated values) just for dual range boards (V965, V1785)
00293         if ( !stricmp(str, "THRESHOLDS_HIGH")) {
00294             char value[ 100];
00295             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00296                         parse_zero_suppression_thresholds( value, p_data->m_zero_suppression_param.m_high_thresholds_buff);
00297             continue;
00298         }
00299         // Enable/Disable the sliding scale feature ( set a non zero value to enable)
00300         if ( !stricmp(str, "SLIDING_SCALE_ENABLE")) {
00301             int value= 0;
00302             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00303             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_sliding_scale_enable= value!= 0;
00304             continue;
00305         }
00306         // Enable/Disable the zero suppression ( set a non zero value to enable)
00307         if ( !stricmp(str, "ZERO_SUPPRESSION_ENABLE")) {
00308             int value= 0;
00309             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00310             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_zero_suppression_enable= value!= 0;
00311             continue;
00312         }
00313         // Enable/Disable the overflow suppression feature ( set a non zero value to enable)
00314         if ( !stricmp(str, "OVERFLOW_SUPPRESSION_ENABLE")) {
00315             int value= 0;
00316             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00317             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_overflow_suppression_enable= value!= 0;
00318             continue;
00319         }
00320         // Enable/Disable the valid suppression feature ( set a non zero value to enable)
00321         // V775 ONLY!!!!
00322         if ( !stricmp(str, "VALID_SUPPRESSION_ENABLE")) {
00323             int value= 0;
00324             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00325             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_valid_suppression_enable= value!= 0;
00326             continue;
00327         }
00328         // Enable/Disable the common stop acquisition mode ( set a non zero value to enable)
00329         // V775 ONLY!!!!
00330         if ( !stricmp(str, "COMMON_STOP_ENABLE")) {
00331             int value= 0;
00332             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00333             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_common_stop_enable= value!= 0;
00334             continue;
00335         }
00336         // Enable/Disable empty event storing feature ( set a non zero value to enable)
00337         if ( !stricmp(str, "EMPTY_ENABLE")) {
00338             int value= 0;
00339             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00340             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_empty_enable= value!= 0;
00341             continue;
00342         }
00343         // Enable/Disable counting all triggers or accepted one only ( set a non zero value to enable)
00344         if ( !stricmp(str, "COUNT_ALL_EVENTS")) {
00345             int value= 0;
00346             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00347             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_count_all_events= value!= 0;
00348             continue;
00349         }
00350         // enable debugging
00351         if (!stricmp(str, "DEBUG")) {
00352             int value= 0;
00353             sscanf(line, "%d", &value);
00354             p_data->m_debug= value!= 0;
00355             continue;
00356         }
00357         // The path of the for where the gnuplot executable is installed
00358         if (!stricmp(str, "GNUPLOT_PATH")) {
00359             char value[ MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT];
00360                         value[0]= '\0';
00361             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00362             strcpy( p_data->m_gnu_plot_path, trim( trim_text_charset, sizeof( trim_text_charset), value));
00363             continue;
00364         }
00365         // Gnu plot refresh rate (msec)
00366         if (!stricmp(str, "GNU_PLOT_REFRESH")) {
00367             int value= 0;
00368             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00369             p_data->m_gnu_plot_refresh= value;
00370             continue;
00371         }
00372         // GnuPlot X conversion factor
00373         if (!stricmp(str, "GNU_PLOT_X_SCALE")) {
00374             float value= 0;
00375             sscanf(line, "%f", &value);
00376             p_data->m_gnu_plot_x_scale= value;
00377             continue;
00378         }
00379         // Raw readout data log filename: set to empty string to disable log
00380         if (!stricmp(str, "RAW_LOG_FILENAME")) {
00381             char value[ MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT];
00382                         value[0]= '\0';
00383             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00384             strcpy( p_data->m_raw_output_filename, trim( trim_text_charset, sizeof( trim_text_charset), value));
00385             continue;
00386         }
00387         // Parsed readout data log filename: set to empty string to disable log
00388         if (!stricmp(str, "PARSED_LOG_FILENAME")) {
00389             char value[ MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT];
00390                         value[0]= '\0';
00391             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00392             strcpy( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename, trim( trim_text_charset, sizeof( trim_text_charset), value));
00393             continue;
00394         }
00395     }
00396     TRACE(  " Done \n");
00397     fclose( p_conf_file);
00398     return ret_val;
00399 }
00400 
00401 char* trim( char charset[], int n_chars, const char* string) {
00402     int i;
00403     char* str= (char* )string;
00404     BOOL found_char;
00405     // Trim leading chars
00406     found_char= TRUE;
00407     while ( found_char&& strlen( str) ) {
00408         found_char= FALSE;
00409         for ( i= 0; i< n_chars; i++) {
00410             if ( str[0]== charset[ i]) {
00411                 found_char= TRUE;
00412                 ++str;
00413                 break;
00414             }
00415         }
00416     }
00417     // Trim trailing chars
00418     found_char= TRUE;
00419     while ( found_char&& strlen( str) ) {
00420         found_char= FALSE;
00421         for ( i= 0; i< n_chars; i++) {
00422             if ( str[ strlen( str)- 1]== charset[ i]) {
00423                 found_char= TRUE;
00424                 str[ strlen( str)- 1]= '\0';
00425                 break;
00426             }
00427         }
00428     }
00429     return str;
00430 }
00431 BOOL parse_zero_suppression_thresholds( const char* line, UINT16 *thresholds_buff) {
00432     int i;
00433     const char* tok;
00434     char buff[ 300];
00435         char trim_text_charset[]= {'"'};
00436 
00437     strncpy( buff, trim( trim_text_charset, 300, line), 300);
00438     memset( thresholds_buff, 0, MAX_THRESHOLD_NUM* sizeof( thresholds_buff[ 0]));
00439     tok= strtok( buff, ", ");
00440     for ( i= 0; ( i< MAX_THRESHOLD_NUM)&& tok; i++) {
00441         int tmp= 0;
00442         if ( !strnicmp( tok, "0x", 2)) {
00443             // hex format
00444             sscanf( tok+ 2, "%x", &tmp);
00445         } else {
00446             // decimal format
00447             tmp= atoi( tok);
00448         }
00449         thresholds_buff[ i]= (UINT16)tmp;
00450         tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00451     }
00452     return TRUE;
00453 }
00454 BOOL parse_acquisition_mode_param( const char* line, acquisition_mode_param *target) {
00455     const char* tok;
00456     char buff[ 300];
00457 
00458     strncpy( buff, line, 300);
00459 
00460     tok= strtok( buff, ", ");
00461     if ( !tok)
00462         return FALSE;
00463     target->m_sliding_scale_enable= atoi( tok)? TRUE: FALSE;
00464 
00465     tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00466     if ( !tok)
00467         return FALSE;
00468     target->m_zero_suppression_enable= atoi( tok)? TRUE: FALSE;
00469 
00470     tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00471     if ( !tok)
00472         return FALSE;
00473     target->m_overflow_suppression_enable= atoi( tok)? TRUE: FALSE;
00474 
00475     tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00476     if ( !tok)
00477         return FALSE;
00478     target->m_empty_enable= atoi( tok)? TRUE: FALSE;
00479 
00480     return TRUE;
00481 }
